name: 簡慧貞
objective:
聯合國政府間氣候變化專門委員會 (Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, IPCC) 2022 年 2 月公布第六次評估報告 (IPCC AR6) 指出，全球暖化將在近 20 年內升溫至攝氏 1.5 度，多種氣候危害的增加，如極端氣候災難、熱浪、生物多樣性喪失等，全球皆無法倖。這些危害衝擊到了能源、水資源與糧食安全，並造成許多居住地與生物棲地的喪失。

科學證實，氣候變遷的負面影響十分危急，引起了國際社會、跨國企業及在地團體的高度關注。各國積極提出「2050 淨零排放」的宣示與行動，顯示出全球共同應對氣候變遷的決心。

根據數據，臺灣的溫室氣體排放總量已逐步減緩並與經濟成長脫鉤，且 2019 年，溫室氣體淨排放量為 265.62 百萬公噸二氧化碳當量，已降至 2005 年基準年水準以下。同時，碳排放密集度（即每單位 GDP 的二氧化碳排放量）較基準年減少了約 34%，顯示臺灣的溫室氣體排放已經與經濟成長脫鉤。

為了共同承擔全球減碳目標我國已將 2050 淨零排放納入法律框架，引領未來中長期因應氣候衝擊的行動。此舉必須透過跨世代、跨領域、跨國際的轉型工程，方可達標。
在實現 2050 淨零排放的目標上，臺灣已推動能源、產業、生活、社會等四大轉型策略。這些策略將幫助臺灣逐步邁向永續社會。國際為確保環境、經濟、社會之永續發展，更積極落實在因應氣候變遷對環境、人類生存和國家安全的威脅轉型路徑策略上，巴黎協定後全球已有 130 多國提出「2050 淨零排放」的宣示與行動。為國際接軌此一全球趨勢，各國紛紛採取氣候變遷綠色新政，低碳與淨零已成為全球之共同時尚趨勢。本課程將介紹能源轉型 / 節能減碳與低碳經濟及社會之國際趨勢、國際落實淨零之路徑與溫室氣體減量與能源安全相關法規、我國氣候與能源相關法規等，並介紹碳足跡、碳中和等概念，由國際相關案例看我國邁向低碳經濟與社會挑戰與機會。

Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) Sixth Assessment Report (AR6) February 2022 The IPCC AR6 report indicates that global warming will raise temperatures to 1.5°C within the next 20 years. This will lead to increased climate hazards such as extreme weather events, heatwaves, and biodiversity loss, affecting all parts of the world. These impacts threaten energy, water, and food security, leading to the loss of both habitats and living spaces.

Scientific evidence highlights the urgent negative effects of climate change, which have drawn significant attention from the international community, multinational corporations, and local groups. Countries worldwide have committed to "Net Zero Emissions by 2050," demonstrating a collective determination to address climate change.

Taiwan's Greenhouse Gas Emissions Data shows that Taiwan's total greenhouse gas emissions have gradually decoupled from economic growth. In 2019, Taiwan's net greenhouse gas emissions were 265.62 million metric tons of CO2 equivalents, below the baseline year of 2005. Furthermore, the carbon emission intensity (emissions per unit of GDP) has decreased by about 34% compared to the baseline year, indicating that Taiwan's emissions have been decoupled from its economic growth.

Net Zero Emissions by 2050 Taiwan has incorporated the goal of net zero emissions by 2050 into its legal framework, guiding future medium- and long-term actions to mitigate climate impacts. Achieving this goal requires a cross-generational, cross-sectoral, and cross-national transformation effort.

Four Major Transformation Strategies To achieve the 2050 net zero emissions target, Taiwan has promoted four major transformation strategies: energy, industry, lifestyle, and society. These strategies will help Taiwan gradually move towards a sustainable society. Internationally, to ensure sustainable development of the environment, economy, and society, more active implementation of climate change mitigation pathways is necessary. Since the Paris Agreement, over 130 countries have declared actions toward "Net Zero Emissions by 2050." Low-carbon and net zero have become global trends.

Course Overview This course will introduce international trends and implementations of energy transition, energy conservation, carbon reduction, low-carbon economy, and society. It will cover regulations related to greenhouse gas reduction and energy security, as well as Taiwan's climate and energy laws.
